title.narrative: 4.1 EVIDENCES

description.narrative: By 2018, decision-makers in government departments make better use of evidence and primary and secondary data on the situation of children in Senegal for planning, monitoring and evaluating the impact of public policies on child poverty, equity and social exclusion., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2018, children, especially the most vulnerable, benefit from better support for their needs in targeting, public financial management, and social protection mechanisms.

participating-org.narrative: AGENCE REGIONALE DE DEVELOPPEMENT DE KOLDA

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses
Building global / regional / national stakeholder evaluation capacity
Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2018, decision-makers in government departments make better use of evidence and primary and secondary data on the situation ofchildren in Senegal for planning, monitoring and evaluating the impact of public policies on child poverty, equity and socialexclusion.

description.narrative: The National Statistical System was supported to better monitor the SDGs through introduction of new modules in the DHS survey (cash transfer and child functioning modules), and capacity of partners was strengthened to better use data and to conduct evaluation. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019

1.4 Policies and programmes are influenced by analysis and advocacy to reduce child poverty
